content.description: Sit start with a left hand, triangular crimp, that can be pinched, and a right hand, three finger crimp.  From there, work up through the crimps, jugs, and diagonal rail to a juggy topout through the juniper tree.  The holds get larger as the climb gets higher.
content.protection: A few pads and a spot, the landing is rough, as the juniper tree sits directly behind where the problem climbs.
content.location: It is on the North face of Bastion Block.

content.description: Sit start on edges. From there, climb through an assortment of edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a rock directly behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the west face of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on edges, then climb through generous features to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the west face of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge and a left hand sidepull. From there, crank up to a left hand pocket, match, then use the left and right hand sidepulls to a juggy topout.
content.protection: A few pads, the landing is very good on this problem.
content.location: It is on the North face of Bastion Block.

content.description: Sit start with edges. From there, ascend the arete staying more on the west side.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. There is a boulder that is shared with the landing.

content.description: Sit start on the prominent rail. From there, climb through a set of edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west face.
